title: Question:
author: TerahashSolutions
content: Hello everyone! My name is Emmanuel and I own and operate a Bitcoin mining company with multiple facilities in Dubai, UAE.I am the Founder | CEO. Quick background, I am an American living abroad, I served 5.5 years as a US Navy Diver and after searching the world for the best place to mine BTC. I arrived in Dubai, UAE and set up shop! Now my goal is to help all my fellow Americans and anyone else worldwide start Bitcoin mining. My goal is to help you make an informed decision and we can break everything down on a zoom call or google meet. We are your end to end solution for Bitcoin mining (ASIC sales, hosting, repairs and we help in selling your equipment after years of use) and I would be happy to speak to anyone interested in joining us in securing the Bitcoin network for everyone to use. Our rates are some of the best around and we pride ourselves in offering the best prices for ASICS too! Please visit our website www.terahashsolutions.com for more information.Please note, this is not cloud mining. We sell physical ASIC miners to you and we host them at our facilities in the UAE for an all included electricity rate and no other fees. You can even take possession of your ASIC miners at any time and we will ship them to you anywhere. I look forward to speaking to any and all of you! Best regards,   Emmanuel MonteroFounder & CEOTerahash Solutionswww.terahashsolutions.com  | info@terahashsolutions.comBusiness Centre, Sharjah Publishing City Free Zone, Sharjah, United Arab Emirates

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.created_time: September 10, 2023, 10:57:13 PMLast edit: September 11, 2023, 01:16:30 PM by Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Business to do with selling miners is mostly based on trust. So many scammers out here pretending to sell miners.1. How long have you guys been in operation?2. What shows that you are a former US Navy Diver? A simple search showed me nothing. Just trying to prove if this is true or just something made up.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: I served 5 years as a computer tech in the USNWhat was your rank in the navy?What base were you on? what ship were you on?

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on September 10, 2023, 11:17:18 PMI served 5 years as a computer tech in the USNWhat was your rank in the navy?What base were you on? what ship were you on? I guess he is never coming back to answer our queries. Today he was online, and I am sure he read through our repliesbut, he just decided to do a Homer Simpson on us Oh, come on, coward "Navy Diver", talk to us, we don't bite

comments.author: TerahashSolutions
comments.created_time: September 18, 2023, 04:04:36 PMLast edit: September 18, 2023, 04:32:16 PM by TerahashSolutions
comments.body: Hello again everyone! Sorry I have been traveling back and forth for crypto conferences and meetings.Bitcoin_Arena Feel free to ask as many questions as you'd like. I'm happy to answer anything, No Homer Simpsons here! 1. How long have you guys been in operation? -I bought my first Bitcoin in 2016 but started Terahash Solutions earlier this year, My business partner has been operating the facilities for over 3 years. We invested into infrastructure and facilities here in UAE and started our company to serve our customers globally. 2. What shows that you are a former US Navy Diver? A simple search showed me nothing. Just trying to prove if this is true or just something made up.-I'm happy to send you photos from my boot camp, dive school graduating class from NDSTC and my duty stations. Philipma1957What was your rank in the navy? I got out as an E-4 third class petty officer. I served from June 2012-Oct 2017What base were you on? I was stationed as an Instructor for my first command at ASTC Norfolk, Naval station norfolk, VA, then got transferred to MDSU 1 in Jan 2016.what ship were you on? I was never stationed on a ship. Any other questions I'm happy to speak! You can even reach out to me on whatsapp and we can talk more about Bitcoin mining and the Navy! +971555203370Thanks guys!

comments.author: TerahashSolutions
comments.body: https://i.ibb.co/wMQBMdR/Military-ID.jpghttps://i.ibb.co/wMQBMdR/Military-ID.jpghttps://i.ibb.co/wMQBMdR/Military-ID.jpghttps://i.ibb.co/wMQBMdR/Military-ID.jpghttps://i.ibb.co/5WBhvLc/Diver.jpgYou can't see my face but thats me and my green diverhttps://i.ibb.co/wMQBMdR/Military-ID.jpghttps://i.ibb.co/wMQBMdR/Military-ID.jpghttps://i.ibb.co/5WBhvLc/Diver.jpghttps://i.ibb.co/8bb5hxR/Dive-prep.jpgFor the Dive prep, I'm the guy all the way to the left in front.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: TerahashSolutions on September 18, 2023, 04:04:36 PMMy business partner has been operating the facilities for over 3 years.Would you mind providing more information about your business partner?- It's worth noting that your terms and conditions page isn't configured correctly [it goes to the "Contact Us" page].- How can you ensure those who'd choose your hosting services for their newly purchased miners that the miners that'd be assigned to them are actually brand new and not something that's been in use for some time?

comments.author: TerahashSolutions
comments.body: We run our business by leasing facilities and hosting our clients miners at our leased facilities. I personally mine my own farm at these facilities and can tell you from personal experience that the mining experience is great. I hope you understand why we wouldn't publicly list our business partners site and info. Thank you for letting me know about the terms and conditions, we have gotten it corrected!Once your order is placed we can send you your serial numbers and shipping info from our suppliers. We will do anything it takes to build trust with you and you're welcome to come to the facility after youre a client and we can even show you your miner on the wall and match serial numbers!Thank you and let me know if you have any other questions!

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: So let's ignore for bit the website and the discussions on who you are and just do math In your FAQ:QuoteWe offer standard hosting for .08 per kW/h fixed for up to 4 years. For a limited time, you can "buy down" your rate to as low as .06 per kW/h for a small surchargeFirst offer is:QuoteAntminer S19J pro+ 120TH/s$2,205.00PriceLet's take the worse, 8 cents kwh, 80kwh a day, that's $6.4, 120TH/s at 6.1 cents per th/s according to viabtc, it's $7.32.That's 90 cents so we're looking at 6.5 years of ROI.It gets better with the promo, $4.8 costs, $7.3 income, ~880 days of ROI, way better.For the S19xp we're looking at  $4.3 cost and $8.5 income, so again under 1000 days.My humble opinion, find a way to make the limited time permanent otherwise nobody who buys and hosts with you can find a way to make money!

comments.author: TerahashSolutions
comments.body: Hey thanks very much for your comment and feedback! .08 is for clients who want fixed long term rates, our biggest clients have a long term perspective and want 1 less factor to think of so they choose to pay a surcharge upfront and secure .06 for up to 4 years. They are looking at minimum of 3 years of mining and they believe in BTC and the price going up over the next few years.Lets be honest, you do not buy BTC and HODL nor start mining if you don't think that the price of BTC will be worth more in the future than it is today. If a client wants a 12 month hosting agreement we offer .07 with no buy down payment. So the miner price is $1950 (updated today) +170 for hosting so $2120 total. This includes all fees, shipping, power cables, tariffs, customs, set up and installation, you name it. You will be paying $170 per month to have hosting at .07 per kWh. Hosting is not for everyone, if you have free electricity or a personal hydrodam in your backyard you are certainly better off mining yourself, but this isn't reality for most people. Most people have electricity rates of .10- .50 cents which is very unprofitable for mining. We have a client from Czech Republic who switched to hosting with us because of very high electricity prices and he is very happy now. He is mining with L7s. This is also what I recommend to people until the S21 comes out next march-april. Although we still have large orders for S19J pro+ 120th. The halving will be a big factor in profitability for bitcoin miners. Thanks for your time and for contributing! BTCBTCBTC

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: TerahashSolutions on September 25, 2023, 02:28:53 AMLets be honest, you do not buy BTC and HODL nor start mining if you don't think that the price of BTC will be worth more in the future than it is today. Okay, so let's do it BTC way.$2205 buys you a contract for the S19J or 0.0816858 BTC.Before electricity costs, the S19J at 120TH/s will earn you 0.00000229 BTC x 120, that's 0.0002748 per day.Those are 297 days of earnings in BTC without power.Now let's assume the price will go up in batches of 100 days of x2 to x16, that's $432k....... so common!Batch one, current prices:Electricity prices are 0.0002370, you earn 0.0002748, so you make 0.0000378x 100 , 0.00378Batch two, bitcoin x2 upElectricity prices are 0.0001180, you earn 0.0002748, so you make 0.00001568x 100 , 0.01568Batch 3, bitcoin x2 but the halving comes so you earn fewer coinsElectricity prices are 0.0000600, you earn 0.0001374, so you make 0.00000774x 100 , 0.00768Batch 4 , bitcoin x2Electricity prices are 0.0000300, you earn 0.0001374, so you make 0.00001074x 100 , 0.01068Batch 5 , bitcoin x2Electricity prices are 0.0000150, you earn 0.0001374, so you make 0.00001220x 100 , 0.01268At the end of 500 days, you have earned 0.0505, if you had bought BTC you would have had 0.0816!It will take you an additional 300 days to gain the rest in BTC.And you know, we assumed the hashrate so your share in BTC stays the same, which at 400k pe coins it's impossible as people will resurrect S5 to mine.QuoteWe have a client from Czech Republic who switched to hosting with us because of very high electricity prices and he is very happy now. He is mining with L7s.I already told you the numbers are not that bad for other sha256 deals, what I was pointing was the money pit of the s19j at 8 cents kwh.

comments.author: TerahashSolutions
comments.body: I agree that the S19J pro+ 120th is a riskier investment then the L7 for example, which I highly recommend. Or waiting until next year when the S21 comes out, but we still have investors throwing large amounts of capital into these S19J pro+ 120th by the hundreds. At the end of the day, my goal is give self miners that are paying .10, .12 or higher per kWh a better option by offering a trustworthy hosting experience.Because even .08 kwh is better than .10 kwh.Thank you for taking the time to write, I appreciate it. BTCBTCBTC
